page.title: 19CAMBERLEY POLICE cont.
page.content: Between 8-9.30am & 4-5.30pm police are busiest directing traffic on the A30 where most accidents occur. Speeding is the most common driving offence. Frequent royal visits require police help from other areas. During the recent miners' strike Camberley police were drafted all over the country from Kent to Yorkshire. They often earned overtime of Â£250 per week.Salaries vary from Â£6,708 for a new PC to Â£13,944 for an Inspector. Ken Clarke,one of our local 'bobbies', has written a book about Camberley before the 1st.World War.He gives lectures to many different organisations - it helps with "community policing".Our school 'contact'officer is WPC Robinson.The police have changed their previous policy of mechanical efficiency. Law and order is the government theme.
